temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: Most relevant species of Campylobacter can grow at a temperature between 30 and 42 °C, although their optimal range is 37-42 °C. Even if they cannot grow below 30 °C, they can survive at lower temperature, including refrigeration ones, such as -4°C.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Campylobacter are “microaerophilic” organisms, meaning that they require oxygen, but at a lower concentration (3-15%) than the one found in the atmosphere (21%) and an elevated concentration of carbon dioxide (10% CO2)

ph.title: Ph range
ph.content: Campylobacter cannot survive below a pH of 4.9 and above pH 9.0 and can grow optimally at pH 6.5–7.5.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: With a water activity of 0.987, Campylobater is very sensible to dry environment.

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content: Campylobacter has a low tolerance to salt, and it cannot grow with sodium chloride concentrations above 2.0%, with optimal growth at 0.5%. The concentrations are well below the ones used in those foods where salt is used as preservative.
